title: Environment Modules
text: Although module_load() add module’s libraries LD_LIBRARY_PATH, allow compile packages , R necessarily able actually run packages use libraries. example, let’s say want use hdf5r package, depends hdf5 library package. don’t hdf5 loaded, fail: can resolve loading appropriate module. Firstly, need find module called: loading module: Now let’s try : Finally, can load package … can ? alluded , R doesn’t actually load every new library becomes available environment. Rather uses “load-time linking”, libraries links fixed time start R. Now, can resolve error closing R, loading module, restarting R, can quite annoying. Fortunately, R also supports “run-time linking”, can enable loading module link_libs=TRUE argument: worked! interested theory underlying happening , might find explanation linking Linux helpful: https://techblog.rosedu.org/library-management.html.
code: install.packages("hdf5r", quiet = TRUE) #> Warning in install.packages("hdf5r", quiet = TRUE): installation of package #> 'hdf5r' had non-zero exit status module_avail("hdf5") ------------------- /stornext/System/data/modulefiles/tools -------------------- hdf5-mpich/1.10.5_3.3    ----------------- /stornext/System/data/modulefiles/bioinf/its ----------------- hdf5/1.8.16  hdf5/1.8.20  hdf5/1.8.21  hdf5/1.10.5  hdf5/1.12.1  hdf5/1.12.2    Key: modulepath  default-version module_load("hdf5/1.12.2") #> ✔ Successfully loaded hdf5/1.12.2 install.packages("hdf5r", quiet = TRUE) library(hdf5r) #> Error: package or namespace load failed for 'hdf5r' in dyn.load(file, DLLpath = DLLpath, ...): #>  unable to load shared object '/stornext/Home/data/allstaff/m/milton.m/R/x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-library/4.2/hdf5r/libs/hdf5r.so': #>   libhdf5_hl.so.200: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory module_unload("hdf5/1.12.2") #> ✔ Successfully unloaded hdf5/1.12.2 module_load("hdf5/1.12.2", link_libs=TRUE) #> ✔ Successfully loaded hdf5/1.12.2 library(hdf5r)

title: Environment Modules
text: package also supports following. module_swap() unloads first module loads second: module_purge() unloads modules:

title: Environment Modules
text: want use feature Environment Modules (yet) dedicated function, can use advanced functions get_module_code get_module_output. want run command doesn’t edit modules, shows output, run get_module_output module edit modules, use get_module_code(), evaluate result:
code: get_module_output(c("show", "hdf5")) ------------------------------------------------------------------- /stornext/System/data/modulefiles/bioinf/its/hdf5/1.12.1:  module-whatis    {HDF5 is a unique technology suite that makes possible the management of extremely large and complex data collections. (v1.12.1)} conflict hdf5 prepend-path PATH /stornext/System/data/apps/hdf5/hdf5-1.12.1/bin prepend-path CPATH /stornext/System/data/apps/hdf5/hdf5-1.12.1/include prepend-path LD_LIBRARY_PATH /stornext/System/data/apps/hdf5/hdf5-1.12.1/lib prepend-path LIBRARY_PATH /stornext/System/data/apps/hdf5/hdf5-1.12.1/lib prepend-path MANPATH :/stornext/System/data/apps/hdf5/hdf5-1.12.1/share/man ------------------------------------------------------------------- get_module_code("reload") |> eval() #> NULL

title: Environment Modules
text: Environment Modules supports loading modules R since version 4.0.0! point package? true, actually package just wrapper around core functionality. need Modules version 4.0.0 run package. main advantages using wrapper nicer function interfaces, ability automatically link R newly loaded libraries. ’m getting error “detect Environment Modules installation”, know Environment Modules installed system. ? First, bash terminal module command works correctly, run modulecmd. R, run Sys.setenv(MODULES_CMD="</path//modulecmd>"), putting output previous step argument value. everything work!

title: Environment Modules
text: EnvironmentModules package R front-end Environment Modules project, offers way load unload packages, commonly used shared HPC (High Performance Computing) environments.

First, bash terminal module command works correctly, run modulecmd. R, run Sys.setenv(MODULES_CMD="</path//modulecmd>"), putting output previous step argument value. everything work!
